title: DissolvPCB umožňuje plně recyklovatelné 3D tištěné obvodové desky s vodiči z kapalného kovu
summary: Researchers from the University of Maryland, Georgia Tech and the University of Notre Dame, have introduced DissolvPCB, a novel 3D printing-based method to fabricate fully recyclable electronic circuits. Presented at UIST 2025, the technique combines polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) substrates and eutectic gallium–indium (EGaIn) liquid metal to create printed circuit board assemblies (PCBAs) that can be […]
title_en: DissolvPCB enables fully recyclable 3D-printed circuit boards with liquid metal conductors
summary_bullets_en: Researchers from the University of Maryland, Georgia Tech, and the University of Notre Dame have developed DissolvPCB, a new 3D printing method for recyclable electronic circuits.
The technique uses polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) substrates and eutectic gallium–indium (EGaIn) liquid metal to create printed circuit board assemblies (PCBAs).
DissolvPCB was presented at UIST 2025, highlighting its potential for sustainable electronics manufacturing.
summary_bullets_cs: Výzkumníci z University of Maryland, Georgia Tech a University of Notre Dame vyvinuli DissolvPCB, novou metodu 3D tisku pro recyklovatelné elektronické obvody.
Tato technika využívá substráty z polyvinylalkoholu (PVA) a kapalný kov eutektické slitiny gallia a india (EGaIn) k vytvoření sestav tištěných obvodových desek (PCBA).
DissolvPCB bylo představeno na UIST 2025, kde bylo zdůrazněno jeho potenciál pro udržitelnou výrobu elektroniky.

The document identifies in-situ additive manufacturing as a transformative approach to fabricating space structures, bypassing launch constraints and enabling rapid production of […]
title_en: Advanced In-Space 3D Printing of Composites for Orbit Use
summary_bullets_en: Researchers from Xi’an Jiaotong University and the China Academy of Space Technology have published a review on in-space 3D printing using polymers and fiber-reinforced composites.
The study highlights in-situ additive manufacturing as a transformative method for creating space structures.
This approach helps bypass launch constraints and allows for rapid production of components in orbit.
summary_bullets_cs: Výzkumníci z Xi’an Jiaotong University a Čínské akademie kosmických technologií publikovali přehled o 3D tisku ve vesmíru s využitím polymerů a vláknem vyztužených kompozitů.
Studie zdůrazňuje in-situ aditivní výrobu jako transformační metodu pro tvorbu vesmírných struktur.
Tento přístup pomáhá obejít omezení spojená s vypouštěním a umožňuje rychlou výrobu komponent na oběžné dráze.

title_en: 3D Printing Technology Reshapes Pediatric Tuberculosis Treatment
summary_bullets_en: Additive manufacturing is transforming pediatric TB treatment through personalized drug delivery.
3D printing enhances surgical planning and creates tailored educational tools.

summary_bullets_cs: Aditivní výroba mění léčbu dětské tuberkulózy díky personalizovanému podávání léků.

title: 3D tisk v pevném stavu přeměňuje vesmírný odpad na funkční komponenty
summary: Researchers at Baylor University and CisLunar Industries have developed a vertically integrated method to transform cast aluminum space debris into fully dense, structurally sound components using solid-state additive manufacturing. Their combined system—electromagnetic continuous casting followed by twin-rod additive friction stir deposition (TR-AFSD)—refines grain structure, consolidates defects, and produces pre-machined parts suitable for orbital or lunar […]
title_en: Solid-State 3D Printing Turns Space Debris into Functional Components
summary_bullets_en: Researchers at Baylor University and CisLunar Industries have developed a method to convert space debris into functional components using solid-state 3D printing.
The process involves electromagnetic continuous casting followed by twin-rod additive friction stir deposition (TR-AFSD).
This method refines grain structure, consolidates defects, and produces pre-machined parts suitable for use in space environments.
summary_bullets_cs: Výzkumníci z Baylor University a CisLunar Industries vyvinuli metodu pro přeměnu vesmírného odpadu na funkční komponenty pomocí 3D tisku v pevném stavu.
Proces zahrnuje elektromagnetické kontinuální lití následované depozicí pomocí dvojitého třecího míchání (TR-AFSD).
Tato metoda zjemňuje strukturu zrn, konsoliduje vady a produkuje předem opracované díly vhodné pro použití ve vesmírném prostředí.

title_en: Caltech Advances Metal 3D Printing with Hydrogel-Infusion Additive Manufacturing
summary_bullets_en: Caltech researchers have developed a new technique for precise metal 3D printing using hydrogel-infusion.

Technika poskytuje bezprecedentní kontrolu nad návrhem slitin, což umožňuje inženýrství materiálů se specifickými vlastnostmi.
Potenciální aplikace zahrnují biokompatibilní, vysoce pevné materiály.

title: Definitivní konec třetí éry aditivní výroby
summary: 3DP War Journal #57
title_en: The definitive end of the third era of additive manufacturing
summary_bullets_en: The third era of additive manufacturing is coming to a close, marking significant advancements and shifts in the industry.
Key players like UltiMaker, Nikon SLM Solutions, and HP have been pivotal in driving innovation during this period.
The industry is now poised for a new phase, focusing on increased efficiency, sustainability, and broader applications.

Klíčoví hráči jako UltiMaker, Nikon SLM Solutions a HP byli zásadní pro pohon inovací během tohoto období.

This initiative marks a significant step towards the serial production of hybrid rockets.
INNOSPACE has established a new Advanced Manufacturing Division to support this effort.

summary_bullets_en: Aconity3D has developed and tested a cryogenic aerospike rocket engine designed entirely by AI.

summary_bullets_en: A new computational framework links structural optimization with environmental sustainability in large-area additive manufacturing.
The study was conducted by researchers from Tampere University, Cranfield University, the University of Jaffna, and the Technical University of Denmark.
The framework was applied to the fabrication of wind turbine rotor blade molds using fiber-reinforced thermoplastics.
summary_bullets_cs: Nový výpočetní rámec propojuje strukturální optimalizaci s environmentální udržitelností ve velkoplošné aditivní výrobě.
Studii provedli výzkumníci z Tampere University, Cranfield University, University of Jaffna a Technické univerzity Dánska.
Rámec byl aplikován na výrobu forem pro rotorové listy větrných turbín s použitím vláknem vyztužených termoplastů.

summary_bullets_en: INNOSPACE, a South Korean space company, is leveraging metal 3D printing technology to enhance the production of rocket parts.

Společnost si klade za cíl vyrábět tyto komponenty rychleji, nákladově efektivněji a s větší účinností.

summary: A team at the Bioengineering Institute of Technology, Universitat Internacional de Catalunya, has developed a DIY coaxial 3D bioprinter by modifying a Creality Ender 3 Pro desktop 3D printer. The open-source system costs under €600 and enables simultaneous extrusion of two hydrogel bioinks through a coaxial nozzle. The device was validated by printing mesenchymal stem […]
title_en: Affordable DIY Bioprinter Enables Coaxial 3D Printing of Soft Cell-Laden Hydrogels
summary_bullets_en: Researchers at the Bioengineering Institute of Technology have created a DIY coaxial 3D bioprinter by modifying a Creality Ender 3 Pro.
The open-source bioprinter costs under €600 and allows for the simultaneous extrusion of two hydrogel bioinks.
The system was validated by successfully printing mesenchymal stem cells.
summary_bullets_cs: Tým z Bioengineering Institute of Technology vytvořil DIY koaxiální 3D biotiskárnu úpravou Creality Ender 3 Pro.
Open-source biotiskárna stojí méně než 600 € a umožňuje současnou extruzi dvou hydrogelových bioinkoustů.
Systém byl ověřen úspěšným tiskem mezenchymálních kmenových buněk.

title: 3D tištěné nanoklastry a AI umožňují detekci rakoviny štítné žlázy ze séra
summary: Researchers at Pusan National University in South Korea have developed a 3D printing-based diagnostic method that detects thyroid cancer using surface-enhanced Raman spectroscopy (SERS) on human serum. The technique bypasses the need for traditional biomarkers by analyzing spectral patterns with a convolutional neural network (CNN), achieving 93.1% sensitivity and 84.0% specificity. Results were published in […]
title_en: 3D Printed Nanoclusters and AI Enable Serum-Based Thyroid Cancer Detection
summary_bullets_en: Researchers at Pusan National University have developed a 3D printing-based method for detecting thyroid cancer.
The technique uses surface-enhanced Raman spectroscopy (SERS) on human serum.
A convolutional neural network (CNN) analyzes spectral patterns, achieving 93.1% sensitivity and 84.0% specificity.
This method eliminates the need for traditional biomarkers.
summary_bullets_cs: Výzkumníci z Pusanské národní univerzity vyvinuli metodu detekce rakoviny štítné žlázy založenou na 3D tisku.
Technika využívá povrchově zesílenou Ramanovu spektroskopii (SERS) na lidském séru.
Konvoluční neuronová síť (CNN) analyzuje spektrální vzory, dosahuje 93,1% citlivosti a 84,0% specificity.
Tato metoda eliminuje potřebu tradičních biomarkerů.

title: Důležité zprávy: i.materialise a Materialise OnSite se spojují tento říjen
summary: As of October 2025, Materialise will merge its two online ordering platforms into one: Materialise OnSite. Below, you’ll find some helpful info about what’s next, what to expect, and what it all means for now.  Merging our two platforms under one banner is the logical next step in a journey that we’re incredibly proud of. It’s also an important one; by consolidating our efforts, we can continue to provide quality 3D-printed parts and prototypes you’ve come to expect from Materialise.  What this means for i.materialise Starting October 31, 2025, you’ll no longer be able to place orders or use the shop feature on i.materialise, but you’ll still be able to log in to view your account information. You can continue to use the platform as usual until then, after which we hope you’ll continue to choose us as your 3D printing partner via Materialise OnSite. Test it out with an exclusive discount! Want to try OnSite before the big day? Create an account and use code hsqnmogr to get 10% off every OnSite order between August 1st and 31st inclusive — use it as many times as you like!   What to look for on Materialise OnSite   As OnSite has always specialized in producing industrial parts and products, it has a few interesting features that you won’t have seen on i.materialise.   Performance-grade materials: Access specialist polymers suitable for demanding industrial applications. Fast Lane: Get your parts shipped within 48 hours when you work with select materials — look for the ⚡symbol. Precious metals: Expect to see brass, bronze, copper, gold, and silver on OnSite in October OnSite is constantly evolving, so new features are just around the corner. Create an account, and we’ll keep you in the loop with detailed email updates on all the latest enhancements. It’s the easiest way to get the most out of your online 3D printing experience. If you’re looking for a particular material while exploring OnSite, one aspect you may need to consider is the differences in how they’re named — this article has all the information you’ll need about those changes. You can also get answers to all your technical questions via our support center. Thank you for everything  To everyone who has made this platform a part of their 3D printing journey, we want to end by saying thank you. i.materialise was a trailblazer. A hub of ingenuity, creativity, and exploration — a spirit we hope you’ll bring with you when we make the move this October! After all, this isn’t goodbye. It’s see you over there.  Join us on Materialise OnSite  Ready to continue the journey with us? Create your account on the new platform.
title_en: Important News: i.materialise And Materialise OnSite Are Merging This October
summary_bullets_en: Materialise is merging its two online platforms, i.materialise and Materialise OnSite, into one by October 2025.
i.materialise will cease order placements from October 31, 2025, but users can still access their accounts.
Materialise OnSite offers features like performance-grade materials, fast shipping, and precious metals.
Users can try Materialise OnSite with a 10% discount code available for use in August 2025.
summary_bullets_cs: Materialise spojuje své dvě online platformy, i.materialise a Materialise OnSite, do jedné do října 2025.
i.materialise přestane přijímat objednávky od 31. října 2025, ale uživatelé budou mít stále přístup ke svým účtům.
Materialise OnSite nabízí funkce jako materiály pro náročné aplikace, rychlé dodání a drahé kovy.
Uživatelé mohou vyzkoušet Materialise OnSite s 10% slevovým kódem dostupným k použití v srpnu 2025.

summary_bullets_cs: Autor sdílí poznatky získané během dvoutýdenního pobytu v Šen-čenu, významném centru technologie 3D tisku.
Pozorování zahrnují rychlé tempo inovací a konkurenční povahu průmyslu 3D tisku v regionu.
Článek zdůrazňuje důležitost Šen-čenu jako globálního centra pro vývoj a výrobu hardwaru.

title: BMW Group přeměňuje odpad na nové výrobní komponenty
summary:
BMW Group Converts Waste Into New Manufacturing Components

July 21
title_en: BMW Group Converts Waste Into New Manufacturing Components
summary_bullets_en: BMW Group is using 3D printing technology to transform waste materials into new manufacturing components.
The initiative aims to enhance sustainability and reduce waste in the automotive production process.
This approach not only minimizes environmental impact but also optimizes resource efficiency.
summary_bullets_cs: BMW Group využívá technologii 3D tisku k přeměně odpadních materiálů na nové výrobní komponenty.
Iniciativa má za cíl zvýšit udržitelnost a snížit odpad v procesu výroby automobilů.
Tento přístup nejen minimalizuje dopad na životní prostředí, ale také optimalizuje efektivitu využívání zdrojů.

title: HeyGears představuje více materiálové 3D tištěné zubní protézy
summary:
HeyGears Introduces Multi-Material 3D Printed Dentures

July 18
title_en: HeyGears Introduces Multi-Material 3D Printed Dentures
summary_bullets_en: HeyGears has launched a new line of multi-material 3D printed dentures.
The dentures were introduced at a special event in a Chicago lab.
This innovation allows for more realistic and functional dental prosthetics.
summary_bullets_cs: HeyGears uvedl na trh novou řadu více materiálových 3D tištěných zubních protéz.
Protézy byly představeny na speciální akci v laboratoři v Chicagu.
Tato inovace umožňuje realističtější a funkčnější zubní protézy.
